section.title: Tutorial2: Show all the genes for the organism Drosophila melanogaster.
section.para: This page will guide you through the query: Show all the genes for the organism Drosophila melanogaster. The aim of this query tutorial is to show you how to combine and constrain objects from two different classes. By constraining the objects from the organism class you will also constrain the objects returned from the Gene class. This query involves:

listitem.para: Constraining the Organism name field to Drosophila melanogaster
Selecting 'gene' and the organism name field to show in the output
Select the starting point for your query. Navigate to the 'Genomics' aspect and select 'gene' from the 'Query starting points'.
The model browser will now be displaying the Gene class and it's fields. Navigate to 'Organism' and expand to show the fields of the Organism class.

You need to constrain the organism name to Drosophila melanogaster. Select the constrain arrow next to the name field of the Organism class. In the constraints box add the constraint: = Drosophila melanogaster. Press 'Add to query' to add this constraint to the constraints list.

You now need to select the fields you wish to view in the results output. In the Model browser select 'show' next to the gene class name and the organism name field. These fields will be added to the 'Fields selected for output' list. Note that you can change the order of the output fields using the arrows, and you can delete a field using the x.
